name: chicagotribune
text: “Hamilton” won 11 Tonys, a Pulitzer and a Grammy, and the filmed version on Disney Plus was the talk of social media throughout July 4 weekend — but it won’t be headed to the Oscars. https://t.co/U9xkAlWCJb

name: chicagotribune
text:
Experts say the coronavirus seems to be most infectious when people are in prolonged contact at close range, especially indoors, and even more so in superspreader events — exactly what scientists would expect from aerosol transmission.

Via New York Times: https://t.co/ijBgcluLNr

name: chicagotribune
text: A Glock 19 decorated with President Donald Trump's image was among weapons confiscated by Chicago police this weekend. https://t.co/UG2CcwH9Um

name: chicagotribune
text: Column: Insisting that sports continue now is illogical. The return isn’t working. It’s time to admit it: This break needs to last longer, writes @sryantribune. https://t.co/jDHaYdT1Rv

name: chicagotribune
text: Commentary: Celebrating Mount Rushmore isn’t remembering history; instead it requires spectacular acts of forgetting. How could we honestly claim to see in this anything worth defending? https://t.co/pTN333dD6q

name: chicagotribune
text: An ordinance to require more COVID-19 help for residents of large Chicago senior buildings has been sent to the City Council for a vote. https://t.co/q0nPm4Jxiy

name: chicagotribune
text: Thousands of Illinois businesses got federal COVID-19 relief loans worth $1 million or more. Search our database here. https://t.co/HNny9JiFjM
